column4: How do I add the following video card to my xorg.conf? 01:0b.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon RV200 QW [Radeon 7500]
Have you tried restriced drivers manager?
It's not supported by the proprietary drivers. It's too old.
Oops misread -- you can use the radeon driver -- just have to install and change in xorg.conf
If you have video already bus id should stay the same... just change driver from vesa to radeon ...
I don't have video already. I'm using the onboard intel video.
Sorry confused --- so you're installing another video card?

I Just installed the os on the machine two days ago, and the radeon card has been there the whole time. There is no mention of it in the xorg.conf. I'm using the crappy integrated video in the meantime.
Does ATI Card show in lspci ?  And what is onboard video chip 9 series or above?
What I pasted earlier was from lspci. The onboard shows up as "Intel Corporation 82810E DC-133 CGC"
right but ATI card doesn't show up at all?  You can lspci  | grep -i radeon
Yes, it does. "ATI Technologies Inc Radeon RV200 QW [Radeon 7500] "
Bus ID should be off to left....
Do I need to preface that with PCI: ?
Yes, what does it say there?
Where?
.... to the left of Radeon in lspci listing...
Hmmm... never seen vid with the b in there... but if that's what it says PCI:1:0:b  --- ??? Dunno you might want get confimration :)
And of course you have to load the fglrx driver and change driver...
Does fglrx support the 7500? I thought it was too old.
Erpp.. sorry meant radeon...
